availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter Everett (Mt. Sterling, Montgomery County, Kentucky, gentleman)

body.p: Mt. Sterling, Kentucky, gentleman, businessman and farmer. Virginia native. Engaged in commerce and agriculture in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned one enslaved person in 1840. Resident of Montgomery County in 1850. Gentleman in Mount Sterling in 1860. Owned one enslaved person (Phil) in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 300.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 7A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 320.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 74A.
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Montgomery County Wills, Estate Inventories, Appraisements, and Accounts, vol. D-F, 1828-1874, p. 539 of 750 of microfilm (accessed through Ancestry.com).
